definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Some reserves were named to cover the possibility of withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 已指明一些替補隊員，爲可能有人退出比賽作準備。

sentences.english: What helped was the infusion of energy from backup center DJ Mbenga.
sentences.chinese: 這位替補中鋒姆本加註入了能量。

sentences.english: Only the two back-up goalkeepers and central defender Raul Albiol did not get playing time.
sentences.chinese: 只有2個替補守門員和中衛阿爾比奧爾沒上場。

sentences.english: Benching a star can have an even stronger impact.
sentences.chinese: 替補席上的明星可以有一個更強大的影響力。

sentences.english: Tottenham striker Jermain Defoe, and maybe Nugent, will be a good option to come off the bench if needed.
sentences.chinese: 熱刺前鋒迪福以及紐根特都將會是有實力的替補。

sentences.english: Can the managers and the substitute players proceed to the waiting area.
sentences.chinese: 請教練員和替補隊員到替換席。

sentences.english: England brought on a sub in the second half.
sentences.chinese: 英國隊下半場換上了一名替補隊員。

sentences.english: We might put Gary on the bench.
sentences.chinese: 我們會讓內維爾打替補。

sentences.english: Combined they had 32 points, 18 rebounds and 13 assists.
sentences.chinese: 替補們一共得到了32分，18個籃板和13次助攻。

sentences.english: We have several alternates on our team.
But Owen is not an understudy .
sentences.chinese: 但是歐文不應該是替補演員。

sentences.english: The Mavs also have a deadly bench with Stackhouse and Terry.
sentences.chinese: 小牛同樣也具備擁有斯塔克豪斯和特里的致使的替補。

sentences.english: Two minutes later, a disbelieving Bayern fell victim to another goal, this time from Brazilian sub Juary.
sentences.chinese: 2分鐘後，拜仁又丟一球，這一次是巴西替補圖裏。

sentences.english: He was benched during the football game.
sentences.chinese: 足球賽時，他是替補隊員。

sentences.english: Juliana gave her notice last week. We need to replace her.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉安娜上週提出辭呈了，我們得找人替補她。

sentences.english: As a result Senderos may have to settle for a place among the substitutes this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 因此，森德羅斯也許會作爲替補出現在本週末比賽上。

definition: to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
initial/arising first/same as 首先發起|首先发起
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
